website_summaries.verdict: Customers desiring a plant-based option will delight in this efficient brush.
pros: Toothbrush materials are plant-based using bamboo and a vegetable oil base
cons: Brush head bigger than some customers expected
Bristles can be hard on gums

customer_reviews.title: Good for years until a new one falls apart
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these toothbrushes for about 2 years now and I’ve never had an issue. Today however this toothbrush that I opened maybe a month ago...3 sections of this toothbrush fell out in my mouth while I was brushing my teeth this morning...not sure if it’s just this toothbrush..the others never gave me problems besides my husbands toothbrush that had started to fall apart after only a month of use as well. He doesn’t want to use it again. I really like the toothbrushes and want to order more but I don’t want them falling apart in my mouth again while I’m getting ready for my day...
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Norris

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: In an ongoing effort to ditch the plastics - it is SO hard to find a natural toothbrush where the bristles aren't plastic! While this is partial plastic, the fact that there was some plant-based material there was great. We LOVE these brushes. The head is a great size, bristles perfect softness, and the handles are great size wise to hold. We did use a sharpie to mark the handles so we know whose is whose, and we did have to stop keeping them in a cup, because the bottoms don't dry. We've purchased a new tooth brush holder to help with that problem. Will absolutely purcahse more!
customer_reviews.author: MSH

customer_reviews.title: A good choice for a conscious consumer
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned when the first of the four brushes started losing bristles within the first month. I decided to withhold judgement and I'm glad I did. The next two brushes lasted me several months each until the bristles lost their firmness. Now I'm on the last one and will probably re-order these. These brushes are much more sustainable than plastic toothbrushes and for that purpose alone, I highly recommend them. They are quite ergonomic in your hand, and although not as durable as their cousins from Australia and New Zealand (the bamboo brushes there easily lasted a half year each), I still very much enjoyed using them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Really great toothbrushes!!!!! My husband even loves them!! I heard about brush with bamboo from Kate Arnell and her Zero Waste channel on YouTube, EcoBoost. She is fantastic and fun to watch!! She was not wrong about these toothbrushes being awesome!! I’m so glad they are available to me!! The packaging is totally recyclable and biodegradable! Thank you Kate Arnell!!!!! I love brushing with bamboo!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Burke

customer_reviews.title: WORLD MOST ACCREDITTED USDA CERTIFIED!!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS brush is superior to all the plastic bristled bamboo wanna Bee’s out there. Thousands of bamboo HANDLED toothbrushes are all better than plastICK...but this brand rules! Stop reading this and grab yours now. They last until they splay which can take many many months ..in my case 24! I keep taking it to my dentist who tells me it’s perfectly fine so why throw it out? Plant bristles seem to absorb plaque in a way plastic is clearly not designed to do. I will NEVER use a plastic toothbrush again!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn hogan

customer_reviews.title: Who knew?
customer_reviews.text: Who knew you could brush with bamboo! Love these!! After becoming aware of the amount of plastic toothbrushes in our landfills and the negative impact associated with all that plastic I wanted to find a safer option. These are perfect! It took just a little getting used to since the brush head is a little bigger than my old toothbruses. Other than that I have no complaints! I've been using the same one for almost 3 months now. Other than some whitening in the middle from my toothpaste it looks new! The bristles have yet to fall out compared to my 4 year old daughter's from a different company.
customer_reviews.author: The Rogers'

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bamboo Toothbrushes!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an alternative to plastic toothbrushes when I stumbled upon these bamboo toothbrushes. I'm trying to choose more sustainable options when making purchases, and bamboo toothbrushes that are biodegradable are a much more eco-friendly alternative to plastic toothbrushes. These have a nice shape to them. I can hold them easily and comfortably in my hand. The bristles feel nice and soft, and they don't fall out. I really like the 4-pack. It has helped remind me to switch out brushes every few months, which is something I used to slack on. My dentist always comments on how healthy my teeth are and tells me to just keep doing what I'm doing. Bamboo toothbrushes for the win!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Good brush but PLASTIC covers?! (So y’all lying?)
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Bamboo handle is ergonomic, lasts a long time, bristles are just the right amount of soft-firm. CONS: Bristles are naturally derived maybe but that doesn’t mean they compost. They don’t. the individual wrapper INSIDE the cardboard box looks sounds feels every bit like plastic?!?! So they lied with the all-natural claim? This is my second purchase of the 4-brush set. The first was wrapped in paper that had a beeswax like glaze. This looks SUSPICIOUSLY like plastic. what’s up Total Bamboo folks?
customer_reviews.author: Odt

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Impressed so far. My friend also likes them. I love the company and the fact that the packaging is low waste and plastic free. Just remember to look into how to actually compost the brush in your area. Throwing it in the trash defeats the purpose because compostable things (even food) get trapped and can’t break down. And when they do, it just sits in the landfill rather than being reused as soil like a compost site would do.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Good grip clean brush every time.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the handles. You can actually grab them and the grip naturally very firm I can finally CONTROL my brushing it feels just like a solid peice of balsa wood. GOODBYE slimy, rubbery and nasty China Death plasic. Takes me 3 minutes instead of 6 with the electric plastic death I threw out and does a noticably better job.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Eco but lack in ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: Hey r okay. Eco wise it’s great But as a brush the ergonomics r not very friendly. The form is too squared and the brushes r bit too hard for me. Have to be extra gentle to brush. I don’t get the shape of the brush. For me it’s not very efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great Handle but Crappy Bristles
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this tooth brush the bristles came out into my mouth. Not a great feeling when you are spitting out the bristles every other time you brush. I love the feel of the handle but will not buy this product again (I regret buying 4 of them now).
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D. Zelik

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Environmentally Friendly
customer_reviews.text: These are great toothbrushes. I like that they come in a 4 pack so I always have a few extra at the house. They don't seem to last quite as long as plastic toothbrushes, but still about 2 months for me. I've used different brands of bamboo toothbrushes and the bristles fall out easily and get stuck in my teeth. I've been using this toothbrush for about 9 months now and have no plans of switching again soon. I even gave up my electric toothbrush for these. I don't have a problem with the bamboo getting soggy or moldy either.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Lane

customer_reviews.title: Plastic defeats the point
customer_reviews.text: I bought these toothbrushes to try and decrease my plastic usage in our home. The bamboo tooth brush does a good job, and is in a cardboard box, but the toothbrush is also in a plastic cover since there is a whole in the outwe cardboard. Otherwise, it's a good tooth brush and lasts a good while. Might buy again
customer_reviews.author: ImoNatsu

customer_reviews.title: USA made bristol. Chinese made handle...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for natural alternative to plastic toothbrushes, which this offers, but I also wanted a USA made product. Packaging (which I wish Amazon would FULLY post pictures of for all products to avoid this mystery) details that "plant based nylon bristols made in USA. Toothbrush handle made in China with Certified 100% organic bamboo. Bamboo is certified organic by CERES of Germany. Compastable packaging made responsibly in China. ....AND they're not returnable, so made sure this is what you want before you buy!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: environmentally friendly
customer_reviews.text: We change out our toothbrushes frequently, and these fit the bill for that. They don't 'grow moldy', they don't have bristles breaking off, they fit into any tooth brush holder whe'e tried to put them into, not too fat to fit into the different holders. They come in cardboard packaging. Now, if Amazon could start shipping in paper envelopes instead of plastic, we'll be all set.
customer_reviews.author: K. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Best toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: These are the best toothbrushes on the market. If you’re looking for eco toothbrushes give these a try! This is my third time ordering and I will continue ordering. I highly recommend this product. You can recycle the bamboo sticks or reuse in your garden as labels or whatever you want !!
customer_reviews.author: B. T

customer_reviews.title: Nice toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I really like that they are made from something sustainable, rather than plastic. The bristles are pretty soft, which is nice. The handle feels good in your hand. I'm a pretty hard brusher, so I'm not sure how long one will last, as the bristles are already getting a little smashed out after only a few weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bednarek

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when I started getting into the zero waste thing and was trying to eliminate plastic from my life. These bristles are nice and soft and contour perfectly to your teeth. The handle has a nice, ergonomic feel also. I will also be cutting half the handle off of one to use as my travel toothbrush when backpacking, as they are super light and I can just sand down any jagged edges. I will definitely be buying these again!!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Bowser

customer_reviews.title: Taste like wood
customer_reviews.text: I hated the aftertaste the toothbrush leaves in my mouth. It tastes like wood. But, the brush is great for gun cleaning. I clean my beretta 92 and my glocks with these brushes, and they work just great. I highly recommend them for gun cleaning... otherwise they suck.
customer_reviews.author: Texican Lonestar

customer_reviews.title: Best toothbrush I've ever used and it's good for the planet too!
customer_reviews.text: I read comments about the bristles being too hard or soft and I have to say they are perfect; they are soft enough to flow around my teeth but have some firmness to them so they scrub my teeth well. I've had trouble with other toothbrushes leaving a film on my teeth and that doesn't happen with this toothbrush. Buy this toothbrush for a healthier, cleaner mouth while reducing plastic waste. It's a win win situation. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Susan Theiss

customer_reviews.title: My relatives were all so pleased to be introduced to a more eco-friendly toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these toothbrushes for myself and family members last Christmas. My relatives were all so pleased to be introduced to a more eco-friendly toothbrush. I visited my relatives recently and saw that they have been using the toothbrushes, too. No complaints from them. For myself, I also purchased a wooden brush with boar bristles. I can't decide which brush I like better. In theory I prefer the boar bristle brush. But in practice I think I prefer this one slightly. It leaves my mouth feeling a little cleaner. But maybe not SO much cleaner that it justifies purchasing more nylon!
customer_reviews.author: KLennon

customer_reviews.title: Gets rough after rinsing with water
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of these toothbrushes and toothpaste get a lot for your money. However, the bamboo gets rough on your lips after just a few uses from rinsing in water. They need to be sealed with wax. I also am irritated the bristles are made of nylon, so these aren't truly zero waste.
customer_reviews.author: alison

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I was worried about it being too soft because I do not like a "soft" toothbrush but this is closer to medium. It smelled weird to me the first few uses but that wore off quickly. I use it with a homemade coconut oil toothpaste (coconut oil, aluminum-free baking soda, and peppermint essential oil in a Humangear GoToob food grade silicone squeezable container) and it works well. Teeth feel clean. The only difficulty is that they are hard to tell apart. That is easily solved by writing an initial at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: HayesCrewTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Zero Waste, US made Bristles!
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy using this toothbrush, will not go back to plastic! My main reason for buying this was to reduce plastic consumption. The bristles are the perfect stiffness, I hate when the bristles are too soft and they don’t clean well. I’m very surprised how durable it is! I’ve been using it for over a month and still no missing bristles or signs of wear. I always hang my brush upside down so any remaining water will run off.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Came in a cardboard box, with 4 cardboard boxes, 1 around each toothbrush. But then, the brush was wrapped in plastic, which after closer inspection, it states on the box the plastic is made of plant-derived oils, so here's to hoping that's actually true.
customer_reviews.author: jodi florkowski

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Love these toothbrushes. They just feel better in your mouth than typical toothbrushes. And it makes us feel better that we are not adding to the plastic pollution. We have not had any of the bad experiences others have reported. This is our second time ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: good: bamboo, bad: bristles fall out
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to buy 4 bamboo toothbrushes to avoid plastic, and used one for about a year, when one hole of bristles fell out while in my mouth, and I almost choked on them. This was alarming and so I will never use the "Bush with Bamboo" brand, or any other bamboo brand, unless I am assured they bristles will not fall out and injure my throat! Your ad says "Lasts just as long as plastic toothbrush," which is not true. I have used plastic toothbrushes for two or three years before the bristles get too soft. Good try, but show me a safer brush, and don't be so casual about selling them with this flaw!
customer_reviews.author: Anne Brinton

customer_reviews.title: the best in the world!
customer_reviews.text: I have never wrote a review in amazon before. But this is was so good that i must start writing. the best bruch ever. i will never stop buying them for me and for my family. Been using it for awhile but it still looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: DaPope

customer_reviews.title: A Pretty Good Eco Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: The bristles were coming off of one of the 4 toothbrushes I received. I bit annoying, but I just replaced it with another one. Also, the bristles are almost too soft for my needs, and I need to replace the toothbrushes a lot more frequently than a plastic toothbrush. But still, love this product and would recommend you getting it if you're trying to be more plastic free.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush, and environmentally sound, too
customer_reviews.text: Excellent toothbrush. Feels good to hold, the bristles are shaped well and are soft, but not too soft. Did some research, and it looks like this product is made very responsibly. The toothbrushes were wrapped by the company in brown paper (good) but packaged and mailed by Amazon with tons of plastic (bad). Next time I will buy direct from the company, as they don't mail with excess packaging. Great product, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy L

customer_reviews.title: The bristles are very soft.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite toothbrush! The bristles are super soft, which especially nice for my more sensitive gums. It's true that they get a bit gross if you leave them in water. I would not recommend putting these in those toothbrush holder cup things. I just keep mine in a cabinet away from moisture and they maintain their appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: Love These
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my second pack of these because I love them so much. The bristles start out a bit tough but quickly soften after a few uses. These brushes are so comfortable and a great non-plastic option.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Redington

customer_reviews.title: Good product, not for recycling in Mexico.
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good toothbrush, I liked that the bristles are firm and is easy to clean my teeth compared to another brush with plant bristles that I had. I found the size of the brush was quite big for me but I got used to it. What mainly dissapointed me was that although the packaging is made to be composted the plastic bag can only be processed at a special facility, which I couldn't find in Mexico where I live, also the bristles are not easy to recycle here so I'm afraid I won't be buying this brand again due to that. Otherwise it is a really good product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Torres

customer_reviews.title: I love them EXCEPT that when the bristle sections do start ...
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased many kinds of bamboo toothbrushes and with most, the bristles start falling out within a couple weeks. These have lasted the longest on average. I love them EXCEPT that when the bristle sections do start coming out, a tiny piece of metal comes out with them. If you're brushing your teeth when this happens and you accidentally swallow this tiny piece of metal, it just doesn't seem safe. It has sharp little edges and does it have lead in the metal? It could cause physical injury to organs or lodge somewhere internally and leach toxic heavy metals over time. PLEASE consider finding a non-toxic non-metal alternative to this method of securing the bristles into the bristle sockets.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Some good some bad.
customer_reviews.text: The 1st batch of these toothbrushes I ordered were pretty good. The second batch the bristles would fallout while I was brushing. Very unpleasant to have multiple bristles work their way out tickling your mouth and causing gagging. I let the brush dry properlt after each use and never exposed it to heat. This defect is a manufacturing problem and not user created problem.
customer_reviews.author: Chism

customer_reviews.title: These toothbrushes are great! My boyfriend and I both use them
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes are great! My boyfriend and I both use them. Gentle and effective. They usually last a 4-5 months before the bristles start falling out but that's about when I would change my brush out anyway. The bristles are recyclable (I pull them out with pliers very easily) and the handle is compostable! Also, the natural look of the toothbrush suits my decor more than most neon colored toothbrushes which is not a big deal but a definite bonus for me!
customer_reviews.author: The Gear Goblin

customer_reviews.title: NOT environmentally friendly packaging
customer_reviews.text: Packaging is NOT environmentally friendly. Each toothbrush is individually wrapped under the cardboard with plastic that has no indication of being plant based or commercially compost able and therefore would not be accepted by any facility. Package came with tape as well which isn’t a big deal personally but does not match the website description. Don’t appreciate the false marketing! This item can not be returned so no way to inform the manufacturer of the dissatisfaction with the product!
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these!!!! Easy ordering, free shipping, on my Subscribe and save account and item is delivered before the estimated date. I have one in my bathroom, one in my suitcase and keep at least 2-3 as extra for guests. Also, the bamboo sticks make great project/gardening supplies. Must order these!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Sue C

customer_reviews.title: High quality bamboo tooth brush handle with plant-based bristles...
customer_reviews.text: This four pack of bamboo tooth brushes is well worth the money. These tooth brushes are durable and comfortable to use. The wooden handle is a bit thicker than I was previously accustomed to, but I appreciate having natural elements to brush with instead of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Great performing toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: I switched to these from using oral B toothbrushes for years. I wanted something more ecologically responsible and was hoping these would at least do a decent job. I underestimated the performance and feel of these brushes. I like them better than any of the oral B models I've used. These are just great toothbrushes first. The fact that they are more ecologically sound to dispose of turns out to be a bonus. Win-Win. I'll be buying my these again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: 'Net Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I'm attempting to make my household more eco-friendly. I never really thought about how disastrous plastic toothbrushes are to the environment. But a new toothbrush every 3 months can have a detrimental impact on our environment. The head on these toothbrushes will take some getting used to as its not exactly comfortable in the beginning. Although, you'll get used to it. I would recommend these toothbrushes for eco reasons as well as they do get the job done. My son is 10 and I will probably purchase the kid sized ones for him next time as these seem a little too big for his mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2

customer_reviews.title: Work Fantastic! Zero complaints!
customer_reviews.text: Just recently got this 4 pack of bamboo toothbrushes. I absolutely LOVE them. My teeth feel super clean and my heart feels good for helping the environment. I would highly recommend these to anyone who wants to make these small steps to being more sustainable. I did notice some people voicing concerns about the bristles being hard on gums. I did NOT find this to be true, personally. The bristles were very flexible and soft, and I could brush normally without any pain or discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Keith A Layman

customer_reviews.title: Environmentally Friendly
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes are very comfortable to use. The bristles are a medium-soft, and the head is pretty comfortable to use. It's easy to clean, too. Just swipe your thumb through the bristles while holding it under a running faucet, and the excess toothpaste and other debris will easily be removed. Not only that, but these come individually wrapped in a plant based plastic-like wrap and cardboard boxes, which are then wrapped in paper and put in an Amazon envelope. I will be buying these again
customer_reviews.author: BattlChikn

customer_reviews.title: Going green comes with a price
customer_reviews.text: They're good toothbrushes, but eventually mold or what ever that black stuff starts showing up. GROSS!
customer_reviews.author: Corey Hofmeister

customer_reviews.title: Natural Wood and Nice to use.
customer_reviews.text: Being concerned about my health and not wishing to use anything that damages me like plastic toothbrushes for example, I tried these out. Light to hold. Nice to use. The brush part dips in the middle slightly but it seems to contour the teeth therefore, which feels good. Compared to a heavy plastic toothbrush, this is far superior. I am very happy with this purchase. My husband likes them too and he's pretty fussy about things, being a Virgo.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as comfortable as plastic
customer_reviews.text: The square edges on the head make these less comfortable than what I'm used to. With a little touch up on the belt sander, these are perfect. Now if they'd just make them that way to start with....
customer_reviews.author: BRAD

customer_reviews.title: Don't last
customer_reviews.text: The bristles fall out after very little use. Waste. I'll stick to Eco Dent Terradent brushes that have replaceable heads. Less waste and a great soft brush (med too).
customer_reviews.author: Iris Island

customer_reviews.title: 6 is too many... bristles are too hard for my gums
customer_reviews.text: The bristles are too hard for my gums so I can't use it. I would give a better review if it came in something smaller than a 6 pack for this reason alone. Now I have 6 tooth brushes that I can't use. Kind of cancels out the point of buying (and shiping) eco-friendly products.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Shafer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I Thought.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think I was going to like these toothbrushes but that are actually very well-made. The bristles hold up. The only thing that I would change is to make them more ergonomic. The straight handle is a little uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: The Other Side

customer_reviews.title: best toothbrush i have ever had
customer_reviews.text: these toothbrushes are terrific- they are billed as soft, but they are dense enough that they clean as well as a medium, without pain. my only complaint-id like to give them as a gift to my family, but i dont see how to distinguish one brush from another. i saw a different company numbers their brushes- might be a thought...
customer_reviews.author: mary deangelis

customer_reviews.title: Clean Pearly Whites :D
customer_reviews.text: I love these toothbrushes! The handle feels nice and the bristles are not to stiff nor to soft. WAY betteer than the electric one my wife had bought me which than ended up bighting my tounge. Yes my old brush bit my tounge. Now im happy theres no moving parts! Now i just have to worry about splinters... Just kidding. ;) Like I said the handle is well made and there are no splinters possible.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Rosales

customer_reviews.title: Good product and good for the environment
customer_reviews.text: There's too much plastic going to landfills and making its way into the ocean. These toothbrushes help with that problem. If you're used to using expensive, form-fitting plastic brushes, it will take a few days to get used to the utilitarian feel of these brushes. Once you do, you'll never go back to plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes your gums bleed
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give this product one star is because it's the most biodegradable brush I found. But this brush made my gums outright bleed. I've used the PAVICICO toothbrush and though it was rougher than the conventional toothbrush, being slightly more gentle was enough to not have my gums bleed slightly. I doubt I'm getting a good brush considering just how much I need to lighten the contact between my teeth and the toothbrush.

customer_reviews.title: then excellent! It's totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to compost these, then excellent! It's totally worth it. My issue with them is the head of the toothbrush, it's a bit chunky and hurts when you brush molars if you have a smaller jaw, like most of us do. They function like toothbrushes, and wear out about at the same rate plastic ones do. It's a neat idea, and if you're all about zero waste then go for it.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Get exactly what is described
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand because they're transparent. They don't pretend their toothbrushes are 100% compostable/organic like many other companies and that's why I purchased these toothbrushes. Bristles are hard (not too hard), they seem pretty durable and I like that they're recyclable. I used them for approximately a week and I'll probably I'm going to repurchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the environment!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and pretty comfy to brush with. The wooden handle takes a minute to get used to but it's fine. Wish they were a little less expensive. I buy then and give them away. Raise awareness on how many plastic toothbrushes are on this planet 🐟🌏
customer_reviews.author: Karrie Lee

customer_reviews.title: Love these tooth brushes
customer_reviews.text: It is nice to feel good about a product in its own right and, on top of that feel good about doing something that is good for the planet. Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Always Accurate

customer_reviews.title: Better than plastic toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: If you haven’t switched to bamboo brushes I’d highly suggest you stop buying plastic brushes and switch to bamboo brushes. They are as practical and durable as plastic ones and much better for the environment
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Best all natural toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Made of all natural materials, including packaging. Bristles don’t fall out of brush, even after months of use. And brush is not too soft and not too hard. Just right.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Rio

customer_reviews.title: When I first received these I felt so great using something I can compost
customer_reviews.text: When I first received these I felt so great using something I can compost, but soon realized they were pretty much useless. The bristles work for a few day and then they go soft kind of like when you have used a normal toothbrush for a few weeks. If it would last longer, I would buy them again, but using a brush for a week is not reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina23

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied. Bristles Soft.
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with my purchase! Handle is nice and study, and the bristles are great. I noticed a few comments that the bristles were too hard. I have sensitive gums, and I personally have not had any trouble with the bristles being too stiff. Wonderful product! And the price is right for toothbrushes for the rest of the year!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Lost Lasting
customer_reviews.text: I love these brushes! New customer so I don’t have anything to compare it to but I don’t plan on switching because I had no issues at all. They’re made very well, they last as long as a normal toothbrush. I’m happy that the packaging and handle is compostable. My only disappointment is the bristles are not compostable. Overall though, still an excellent choice for an eco friendly brush!
customer_reviews.author: Karissa Mccaskill

customer_reviews.title: Good toothbrush, nothing to special besides the handle being ...
customer_reviews.text: Good toothbrush, nothing to special besides the handle being made of bamboo instead of plastic. Although I suppose that does make it special, instead of purchasing a petroleum based product I like the idea of spending my money on product made from highly sustainable forestry. Bamboo plants grow rapidly and provide oxygen. I will purchase this again and be looking for other bamboo made items.
customer_reviews.author: Eric A.

customer_reviews.title: As promised and on time
customer_reviews.text: It’s so great not to have to worry about adding more non-recyclable plastic into the world-o-sphere
customer_reviews.author: Karen Goozner

customer_reviews.title: A month in and I’m happy
customer_reviews.text: I’m about a month into using my first toothbrush and I have no complaints. I haven’t had an issue with bristles coming out. The softness is similar to my traditional toothbrushes. And my conscience is better.
customer_reviews.author: Pixie

customer_reviews.title: Great Toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: Love this toothbrush. It has a full set of bristles which are shaped to feel comfortable and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Dufresne

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful alternative to plastics!!
customer_reviews.text: Trying to cut down on our plastic use, this is a wonderful alternative. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T Kauhi

customer_reviews.title: my favorite toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: the bristles are very nice and soft, just the way I like it. I am glad to have found a toothbrush that is affordable and is better for the environment than the plastic ones. I will probably use this kind of toothbrush for the rest of my life! The wood feeling on my mouth took a little getting use to, but it is bamboo and not a wood that would split and give you splinters, so don't worry! Its safe and you will get use to it!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Green

customer_reviews.title: Large toothbrush/Cannot be returned
customer_reviews.text: I found the toothbrush head to be too large for my liking and did not like the feeling of the bamboo in my mouth... Just personal preferences. I will also recommend to note that you cannot return these. I failed to read that prior purchase. :(
customer_reviews.author: Brenda M Igler

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I love these eco toothbrushes. At first, my gums felt intruded by the (non BPA) bristles poking in to every nook and cranny, but now they have adjusted, and know it is a very good thing. Teeth feel clean and shiny after brushing, and gums are stimulated! They look amazing in my natural bathroom (which we just painted, etc) too. And, need I say it? No plastic was used in the making of the handles.
customer_reviews.author: Marietta Rhyne

customer_reviews.title: Healthy teeth and healthy environment
customer_reviews.text: I love that these are biodegradable and not harmful to the environment. I've also noticed that the bristles on these work better with my tooth powder than my husbands big name brand toothbrush. It does feel like a wet Popsicle stick when the handle gets wet but it doesn't splinter or anything. I'll definitely be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: H.T.

customer_reviews.title: Have been looking for a compostable toothbrush like this!
customer_reviews.text: Love the feel of the bristles, lasts the appropriate 2-3 months and easy to compost.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Matsumoto-DeVeaux

customer_reviews.title: Saving the environment one toothbrush at a time!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best bamboo toothbrushes out there. The bristles are super soft! I recommend changing this out every couple months, since the bamboo will get wet and yucky over many months of use, but I’m happy I’m reducing my plastic usage by using these. They make great gifts too!
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Bamboo Forest Oral Hygiene
customer_reviews.text: These arrived in perfect condition and on time. I'm using one now every day and like it a lot. It's quite light. I also like the contour of the bristles, which are nylon. That's my only complaint: If the bristles were natural material, then the toothbrush would be completely biodegradable. Still, they work very well and are quite attractive.
customer_reviews.author: M. Varon

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised at these toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice! It's my first time using bamboo toothbrushes and I really like them. I will only use bamboo from now on. No more plastic!
customer_reviews.author: Morrigan

customer_reviews.title: Finally, no plastic toothbrushes!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these toothbrushes. I googled to find out an alternative to plastic toothbrushes and found these. I don't mind the bamboo handle at all. I didn't notice a taste. In fact, for me, I didn't notice anything unusual at all. My boyfriend has the same one so we decorate our own so that we can tell them apart. I think kids would love decorating theirs too! Great toothbrushes. We'll be buying some more as soon as the ones we have need to be replaced!
customer_reviews.author: A. Salgado

customer_reviews.title: I love these! Have been using now for a little ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Have been using now for a little over a year (and hopefully doesn't gross anybody out- but we've been using the exact same toothbrushes this whole time, only cleaned and disinfected them in vinegar a few times). Bristles hold up very well, look like new still. There was a slight wood taste and dryness in our mouths from the wood the first week of using but haven't noticed since. Love everything about this brush- looks, performance, durability!
customer_reviews.author: M.A. Alfaro

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to plastic!
customer_reviews.text: There was not much of a transition to this bamboo brush for me. I very much like and enjoy handling the more natural materials. Using this bamboo brush makes in conducive to retiring it at the proper interval without guilt, thus better overall for your health. Not going back to plastic!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Carboni Taylor

customer_reviews.title: dentist approved
customer_reviews.text: I went in for my check-up after using these toothbrushes the past 2 years and got high compliments.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Haas

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrushes!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST bamboo toothbrushes. When I could no longer find bamboo toothbrushes at my local Target, I tried these. These are far superior to the ones I previously used.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great choice!
customer_reviews.text: Spent some time reading reviews trying to choose a good non-plastic biodegradable toothbrush. I ended up taking a chance on these even without any previous reviews and was pleasantly surprised. These are exactly what I was looking for! A nicely shaped bamboo handle with soft bristles. Also extremely fast shipping I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: George Peters

customer_reviews.title: The head of these toothbrushes is bigger than a conventional ...
customer_reviews.text: The head of these toothbrushes is bigger than a conventional toothbrush. As weird as it sounds, it was awkward to move around in my mouth but I've kinda gotten used to it. The bristles seem to get bent up a little quicker than the Tom's toothbrushes I was using beforehand. Not really impressed with these but their selling point is eco factor, not the product's performance or user experience.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: I love these toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: I love these toothbrushes. They are SO soft compared to my old one, they actually make brushing my teeth a pleasant and pain free experience now. They're pretty light and dry off relatively quickly. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bamboo brushes for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: I agree with all the positive feedback from the other reviews. The contour of the toothbrush is like no other. The handle doesn't slip in your hand and it seems very ergodynamic. The bristles are perfect; not too hard or too soft. If I could afford to change the world, I'd give everyone a bamboo toothbrush!
customer_reviews.author: Hello Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Toothbrush, YES. Friendly Bros. NO.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the toothbrush. This will be my second or third...bought my first at a local soap refill service store in our hippy part of town. Moved away and needed a replacement after my dog used it for a chew toy. Bought this to replace my favorite toothbrush... My problem is that I only received ONE toothbrush. This product is sold as A FOUR PACK. I've contacted 'FRIENDLY BROS.' and we will see what their response is but I am not happy at the moment and either need a refund or three more toothbrushes ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bree in SD

customer_reviews.title: Too hard for "soft bristles"
customer_reviews.text: Too hard if you're looking for "soft bristles." Made my teeth more sensitive, it felt like my teeth were being damaged. I only used one out of the 4-pack, and will be saving the others for guests or emergency toothbrush situations. You never know.
customer_reviews.author: My Garden Haven

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a 4 pack
customer_reviews.text: Eco friendly is reason enough to purchase these. Good price for a 4 pack. The bamboo doesn't bother me at all nor pull at my cheeks as others have said. The bristles are somewhere between soft-medium, which is perfect to prevent too hard of brushing/receding gums. One star off because one "pocket" of bristles fell out when I was brushing, but wasn't a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes are fine. The bristles are soft and the handle is easy to hold and feels good knowing it is bamboo. Definitely worth the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Tommyray

customer_reviews.title: That the toothbrushes are totally recyclable
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this toothbrush for a couple of days, but am totally pleased with it. It is easy to hold and has firm bristles, but not too firm. The thing I like about it the most, and the reason I ordered these toothbrushes in the first place, is because they are totally recyclable.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen D. Pinsky

customer_reviews.title: New take on an old product
customer_reviews.text: My DH wanted these as, he hoped they wouldn’t slip in his hands as much as the plastic toothbrushes out there. And, he was pleased! The bristles are just the right strength & the handle is definitely more comfortable for him!
customer_reviews.author: RestlessHeartTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for weeks now and I'm totally satisfied ! It works just as good as my plastic toothbrush but I know now that I no longer add plastic to the earth. I appreciate these brushes being made available. First class.
customer_reviews.author: WillC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome idea, but bristles too soft...
customer_reviews.text: I love that they are bamboo and biodegradable, but the bristles are super soft, which means they don't last very long. Please make them with harder bristles! Want to keep buying this product!
customer_reviews.author: DaciaQuince

customer_reviews.title: I do not like these brushes
customer_reviews.text: I do not like these brushes. The bristles are uneven and stiff. Hurts my mouth and gums. Thought they would be softer.
customer_reviews.author: Donna O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: Best decision you’ll make for 2018
customer_reviews.text: Just buy these. In bulk. You need to replace your toothbrush when you get sick. And every three months. That all adds up. Keep plastic out of our world. These are amazing. My kids like them too—the small size—because we can personalize them with their names.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Artist

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: If you want to reduce your carbon footprint by not using the world's worst plastic product (toothbrushes) this is the product for you! I cleaned my teeth with this toothbrush and went to the dentist after a few months of using it and had absolutely no problems, no cavities, and hardly any tartar.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The head of the toothbrush is too long and awkward. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Iolanthe

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think it would have worked like it did. Works great. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Clear Lake Man

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Now I know why they sell them in 4 packs. It didn't take long for the brush to deform in the bristle part. Maybe I just personally brush too hard. Works great before that though. Doesn't last as long as the plastic toothbrushes. Also doesn't dry out well between brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: It rtook some getting used to but I'm loving how ...
customer_reviews.text: It rtook some getting used to but I'm loving how the brush feels and the added benefit of saving the planet from plastic one toothbrush at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Goddessm

product_meta.title: Bamboo Toothbrush with Plant-Based Bristles - 4 Pack
product_meta.description: Style:AdultBrush with Bamboo's Adult 4-pack includes 4 certified organic adult sized bamboo toothbrushes. Every part of this product is plant-based: bristles, handle, wrapper, and box. Soft bristles are made from a base of 62% castor bean oil and are made in USA. The handle is made from Certified 100% Organic Bamboo (by CERES of Germany). The wrapper around the toothbrush is plant-based and commercially compostable. The box encasing the toothbrush is made from paper - no tape or glue is used. Your bamboo toothbrushes can be used for just as long as plastic toothbrushes. USA certified. Green America certified. BPA-free. Vegan.
feature_bullets: Soft plant-based bristles made from a vegetable oil base (USA made)
Lasts just as long as plastic toothbrush

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
